Description: Glass beads, monochrome and polychrome, in two strings; plus another string of thirteen beads which may belong. One string with at least one flower bead with red bands, likely made in Egypt (see Curator's Comments and annotated photograph).
Curator's comments: Pers. comm. July 2023: Dr Ellen Swift (University of Kent) identified at least one bead on the photographed string as a type of bead with flower motif and red bands, and two beads as likely Egyptian 'date' beads. See annotated photograph attached to this record. For the 'flower' bead type, see: Arveiller-Dulong, V. and Nenna, M.-D., 2011. Les verres antiques du Musée du Louvre: 3 Parures, instruments et éléments d'incrustation. Paris: Louvre For the 'date' bead type, see: Swift, E., Stoner, J. and Pudsey, A., 2021. A Social Archaeology of Roman and Late Antique Egypt: Artefacts of Everyday Life. Oxford: Oxford University Press
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
